balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

params.amount: Amount of tokens to be burned.
params.tokenId: Identifier of the token to be burned.

bytes32ToHexString(bytes32).details: Converts a bytes32 value to a hexadecimal string.

returns._0: The hexadecimal string representation of the input value.
The URI of the contract metadata.

params.ticketId: The unique identifier of the ticket.

returns.showId: The unique identifier of the show associated with the ticket.

params.showId: The unique identifier of the show.
params.ticketId: The unique identifier of the ticket.

returns.price: The price paid for the ticket.
returns.tierIndex: The index of the ticket tier.

params.initialOwner: The address of the initial contract owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

purchaseTickets(bytes32,uint256,uint256,.details: Breaks down the purchase process into smaller internal functions to manage stack depth.

params.paymentToken: Address of the ERC20 token the show is priced in.

purchaseTicketsFor(address,bytes32,uint2.details: Allows a third-party contract to purchase tickets for a specified recipient.

params.paymentToken: Address of the ERC20 token the show is priced in.
params.recipient: The address that will receive the purchased tickets.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.details: Safely transfers multiple types of tokens from `from` to `to`. This override includes custom logic to update token ownership mapping in the Show contract. It calls the base ERC1155 safeBatchTransferFrom to handle the transfer following the ERC1155 standard.

params.amounts: An array of the amounts of each token ID being transferred.
params.data: Additional data with no specified format, sent in call to `_mint`, `_burn`, or `_transfer`.
params.ids: An array of token IDs being transferred.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers `amount` of token `id` from `from` to `to`.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred.
params.data: Additional data with no specified format, sent in call to `_mint`, `_burn`, or `_transfer`.
params.id: The ID of the token being transferred.

params.newDefaultURI: The new default URI for tickets.

setShowContractAddresses(address,address.details: Sets the address of the Show contract. This function allows the Ticket contract

params._boxOfficeAddress: The address of the BoxOffice contract to be linked with this Ticket contract.
params._showContractAddress: The address of the Show contract to be linked with this Ticket contract.
params._showVaultAddress: The address of the ShowVault contract to be linked with this Ticket contract.

params.newURI: The new URI for the token.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params.tokenId: Identifier of the token for which to retrieve the URI.

returns._0: The URI of the specified token, either a custom set URI or a constructed one

MAX_TICKETS_PER_WALLET().notice: Maximum number of tickets a single wallet is allowed to purchase per show.

boxOfficeInstance().notice: Reference to the Box Office contract for managing ticket sales and queries.

burnTokens(uint256,uint256,address).notice: Burns a specified amount of tokens, removing them from circulation.

contractURI().notice: Retrieves the URI for the contract metadata.

getShowIdByTicketId(uint256).notice: Gets the associated show ID for a given ticket ID.

getTicketPricePaidAndTierIndex(bytes32,u.notice: Retrieves the price paid for a specific ticket and its tier index.

initialize(address,string).notice: Initializes the contract with the Show contract address and metadata URI.

purchaseTickets(bytes32,uint256,uint256,.notice: Purchases tickets, processing payment, minting tickets, and finalizing the purchase.

purchaseTicketsFor(address,bytes32,uint2.notice: Purchases tickets on behalf of a recipient, processing payment, minting tickets, and finalizing the purchase.

setDefaultURIForShow(bytes32,string).notice: Sets the default URI for tickets related to a specific show.

setTokenURI(bytes32,uint256,string).notice: Sets the URI for a specific token ID.

showInstance().notice: Reference to the Show contract for interaction with show-related functionalities.

showVaultInstance().notice: Reference to the ShowVault contract for handling ticket-related financial transactions.

ticketIdToTierIndex(uint256).notice: Mapping from ticket ID to its tier index within a show.

uri(uint256).notice: Retrieves the URI for a specific token ID, incorporating showId into the URI path.

version().notice: Version identifier for the ticket storage implementation.
